==Events==
*[[46 BC]] &ndash; [[Julius Caesar]] defeats [[Titus Labienus]] in the [[Battle of Ruspina]].
* [[871]] &ndash; [[Battle of Reading (871)|Battle of Reading]]: [[Æthelred of Wessex]] fights, and is defeated by, a [[Denmark|Danish]] invasion army.
*[[1490]] &ndash; [[Anne of Brittany]] announces that all those who would ally with the [[List of French monarchs|King of France]] will be considered guilty of the crime of [[Lese-majesty]].
*[[1642]] &ndash; King [[Charles I of England]] sends soldiers to arrest members of [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|Parliament]], commencing [[England]]'s slide into [[English Civil War|civil war]].
*[[1649]] &ndash; English Civil War: The [[Rump Parliament]] votes to put Charles I on trial.
*[[1717]] &ndash; The [[Dutch Republic|Netherlands]], [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Great Britain]], and [[France]] sign the [[Triple Alliance (1717)|Triple Alliance]].
*[[1762]] &ndash; Great Britain declares war on [[Spain]] and [[Naples]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Constantine Hangerli]] arrives in [[Bucharest]], [[Wallachia]], as its new [[Prince of Wallachia|Prince]], invested by the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Samuel Colt]] sells his first [[revolver]] pistol to the [[United States]] government.
*[[1854]] &ndash; The [[Heard Island and McDonald Islands|McDonald Islands]] are discovered by Captain William McDonald aboard the ''Samarang''.
*[[1863]] &ndash; The [[New Apostolic Church]], a Christian and [[Premillennialism|chiliastic]] church, is established in [[Hamburg]], [[Germany]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; The [[New York Stock Exchange]] opens its first permanent headquarters at 10-12 Broad near [[Wall Street]] in [[New York City|New York, New York]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; [[Sofia]] is emancipated from [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] rule.
*[[1884]] &ndash; The [[Fabian Society]] is founded in [[London|London, England]], [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; The [[Oklahoma Land Run]] opens 2 million acres of unused Oklahoma Territory to first serve first come settlers on April 22.
*[[1896]] &ndash; [[Utah]] is admitted as the 45th [[U.S. state]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Topsy (elephant)|Topsy]], an [[elephant]], is electrocuted by [[Thomas Edison]] during the [[War of Currents]] campaign.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[The Scout Association]] is incorporated throughout the [[Commonwealth of Nations|British Commonwealth]] by [[Royal charter]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Operation Carpetbagger]], involving the dropping of arms and supplies to resistance fighters in [[Europe]], begins.
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Burma]] gains its independence from the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: [[China|Chinese]] and [[North Korea]]n forces [[Third Battle of Seoul|capture Seoul]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; The [[Greece|Greek]] [[National Radical Union]] is formed by [[Konstantinos Karamanlis]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; ''[[Sputnik 1]]'' falls to [[Earth]] from orbit.
*[[1959]] &ndash; ''[[Luna 1]]'' becomes the first [[spacecraft]] to reach the vicinity of the [[Moon]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|United States President]] [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] proclaims his "[[Great Society]]" during his [[State of the Union address]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; A military coup takes place in [[French Upper Volta|Upper Volta]] (later [[Burkina Faso]]), dissolving the National Parliament and leading to a new national constitution.
*[[1970]] &ndash; A [[1970 Tonghai earthquake|magnitude 7.7 earthquake]] strikes [[Tonghai County]], [[China]], killing at least 15,000 people.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Rose Heilbron]] becomes the first female judge to sit at the [[Old Bailey]] in London, England.
*[[1974]] &ndash; United States President [[Richard Nixon]] refuses to hand over materials subpoenaed by the Senate [[Watergate scandal|Watergate]] Committee.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: The [[Ulster Volunteer Force]] [[Reavey and O'Dowd killings|shoots dead six Irish Catholic civilians]] in [[County Armagh]], Northern Ireland. The next day, gunmen [[Kingsmill massacre|shoot dead ten Protestant civilians]] nearby in retaliation.
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[1987 Maryland train collision]]: An [[Amtrak]] train ''en route'' to [[Boston|Boston, Massachusetts]] from [[Washington, D.C.]], collides with [[Conrail]] engines in [[Chase, Maryland]], killing 16 people.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Gulf of Sidra incident (1989)|Second Gulf of Sidra incident]]: a pair of Libyan [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-23|MiG-23 "Floggers"]] are shot down by a pair of [[United States Navy|US Navy]] [[Grumman F-14 Tomcat|F-14 Tomcat]]s during an air-to-air confrontation.
*[[1990]] &ndash; In [[Pakistan]]'s deadliest train accident an overloaded passenger train [[Sukkur rail disaster|collides with an empty freight train]], resulting in 307 deaths and 700 injuries.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Wilaya of Relizane massacres of 4 January 1998|Wilaya of Relizane massacres]] in [[Algeria]]: over 170 are killed in three remote villages.
*  1998   &ndash; [[North American Ice Storm of 1998|A massive ice storm]] hits eastern [[Canada]] and the northeastern United States, continuing through [[January 10]] and causing widespread destruction.
*[[1999]] &ndash; Former professional wrestler [[Jesse Ventura]] is sworn in as governor of [[Minnesota]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; Two trains on the [[Røros Line]] [[Åsta accident|collide]] in [[Åsta]], [[Norway]], resulting in an explosive fire and 19 deaths.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Spirit rover|''Spirit'']], a [[NASA]] [[Mars rover]], lands successfully on [[Mars]] at 04:35 [[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]].
*  2004   &ndash; [[Mikheil Saakashvili]] is [[Georgian presidential election, 2004|elected]] [[President of Georgia]] following the November 2003 [[Rose Revolution]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Prime Minister of Israel|Prime Minister]] [[Ariel Sharon]] of [[Israel]] suffers a second, apparently more serious stroke. His authority is transferred to acting Prime Minister [[Ehud Olmert]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; The [[110th United States Congress]] convenes, electing [[Nancy Pelosi]] as the first female [[Speaker of the United States House of Representatives|Speaker of the House]] in U.S. history.
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Burj Khalifa]], the world's tallest building, is officially opened.
*[[2013]] &ndash; A gunman [[Kawit shooting|kills eight people]] in a house-to-house rampage in [[Kawit, Cavite|Kawit]], the [[Philippines]].
